user_specs: ['Hair Condition Curly', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: this doesn’t show up on skin
review_content: Honestly very disappointed with this one because I’ve always had the best luck with benefit cheek products and when I saw a peach blush I was like yeaaaaaaa and I got the mini and I went to put it on..... it didn’t even show on my skin but it showed up when I swatched it but glittery so I thought blush topper but just beware this won’t show up on your skin

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Not my fav color but still a nice blush.
review_content:
When i got the product, it was darker than i thought. So, i started with a very light layer on my cheeks. I could only see shimmer, but almost no blush. Then, I put more on, it did look more peachy but ...with a yellow-ish undertone (not sure if it was only me...)? Anyway, for sure, it does not bright up. I agree with other reviews that it works better as a topper. It also works well when i want a no make-up looking. It would look like natural blush on my skin and i can save the highlight. I am with light skin with yellow undertone.

review_content: It's a pretty cute blush for fair skin tones. It does have shimmer to it. So far I like it. :)

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Fine', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I have begged and begged they would bring this back!! There was no better blush for the pale than Georgia! This is her flashier cousin from down South. It has a shimmer to it that is... fine. I can wear this over Spring and Summer, and it reads okay on camera, but I personally would have preferred the OG.

review_title: Buyer beware for fair skin only.
review_content: This is a disappointing blush, I love warm peach tones. But this did not show up on my light skin. I wouldn’t recommend on med or dark. It’s perfect for fair skin. The palest of pale. I wish benefit would step up their game of being inclusive.

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Dry', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: The old Georgia was a perfect semi-translucent face powder that was universally-flattering, brightened up the face, and smelled amazing. It was one of my first HG products. Bringing back the name and packaging in an entirely different product is annoying and disappointing. Just call it something else.

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Chemically Treated (Colored, Relaxed, or Permed)', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Doesn’t seem like the original to me
review_content: I was using the original over a decade ago and loved it. I was so excited to open this and catch that old familiar smell. However, I don’t remember it smelling so much like plastic. It seems a bit more shimmering as well. Very light wash of color- pretty but may return.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I'm light-toned and love peachy blushes (pink just makes me look ill), and usually prefer creams. This has a nice, smooth finish that sets it apart from other powders - it lasts but doesn't settle in my pores. The shade may be tricky for very fair tones but you don't need much at all. My all time favorite is still Gold Rush but I'd buy this again. My only complaint with the mini is the brush is awkward - I have to use a bronzer brush to get in there.

review_content: Was very excited about this. Unfortunately it just didn’t show up much or lost very long. I applied it in the morning and after being at work for an hour it was gone. Really wanted to like it. Just seems like a waste of a comeback.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: OMG!!! I am so happy you brought this shade back. I have been using the one I bought years and years ago very very sparingly. I am buying the mini and regular size just in case it becomes discontinued.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I'm light complected and this blush is very sheer on me. I ended up adding a light pink blush and used this as a blush topper. I would never have called this product a blush, it's just too sheer. If you are looking for a peachy pink blush like the discontinued Georgia from years ago, this ain't it.

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Straight', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Amazing and beautiful. Love all Benefit blush and highlighter and this is no exception. If you don’t like the ingredients don’t buy it. Never have any issue with these causing breakouts and I have very sensitive skin.

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Chemically Treated (Colored, Relaxed, or Permed)', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: an actual review after using the product
review_content: I really wish people would not enter a review before even using the product. Your personal beliefs do not warrant giving a product you did not try 1 star. It’s a beautiful blush very subtle but pretty. I have acne prone skin and this did not irritate my skin at all.

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Dry', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Ugh, I wish that I could even USE this blush. I take what I put on my skin very seriously because I don’t want the makeup I’m using to break my skin out. I always check the ingredients of every makeup item on cosdna and this product, just like every single one of their other face powders, contains a few ingredients that are level 4 (high level) acne causers and skin irritants. Before I knew about checking products I was using their Hoola bronzer for contouring, and I didn’t understand why I was getting breakouts in the contoured areas. Now I know better. If you have acne or are prone to breakouts, buyer beware. There are plenty of other companies who don’t put acne causing junk into their face powders, I don’t know why Benefit can’t catch on. Hard pass.
